snippet: The wrecked Japanese nuclear plant’s operator said that a pump had stopped, possibly because of human error, in the latest mishap at the facility.
abstract: Tokyo Electric Power Company, operator of Japan's wrecked Fukushima Daiichi nuclear plant, acknowledges that a pump used to cool one of the damaged reactors stopped, possibly because of human error, in the latest problem at the facility; Tepco says it was able to use a backup pump to restart cooling immediately.
lead_paragraph: The wrecked Japanese nuclear plant’s operator said that a pump had stopped, possibly because of human error, in the latest mishap at the facility.

headline.main: Pump for Reactor Stops in Japan
headline.print_headline: Pump for Reactor Stops in Japan
